column4: Okay.  So i have files from an old OSx HFS+ partition that only allows that have the following permissions: owner: read/write group: ZERO Others: ZERO.... I cannot do anything with them... anyway I can get those files?  the hdd was not encryped
if you mount hfs+ you need to pass an extra parameter to mount r/w
how do I do that?
let me check, im running osx too on this pc
thanks.
is the hfs+ partition journalled?
yes sir.
i think thats only mountable read
but it won't even let me do that.  it tells has an X over the folder and says I don't have the permissions to do it.
you mean when its mounted? my hfs+ partitions mount just fine but just as read
yeah, when it is mounted, it won't even let read/ open the folder.
else i can only think of connecting it to a pc and use a hackingtosh style boot cd so you can use disktools to change permissions or disable yournalling
or a mac if you got one around
okay, so the only way to fix the permissions is from the mac.  that is what I needed to know.  Dang, wish I could just see what was in the folder, but I don't ahve read permissions, that sucks.
you can try mounting it
if it doesnt work no loss
just install hfsplus hfsprogs and hfsutils
I have it mounted, and everything, but the single folder, when I double click it to open it, I get the following: You do not have the permissions necessary to view the contents of "Desktop".
and then mount -o force -t hfsplus
if you manage to mount it rw like that you can change the permissions
but if its journalled that might not work, but you can always try
I am downloading those tools, thanks dude!
gl
